questions.question: What is the primary function of a semiconductor foundry in the context of chip manufacturing?
options: Designing the logical architecture of an IC.
Developing software tools for chip verification.
Fabricating integrated circuits based on design specifications.
Marketing and selling finished semiconductor products.
Performing post-fabrication packaging and testing.

questions.question: In the physical design flow of a digital integrated circuit, what does the term 'sign-off' primarily refer to?
options: The initial phase where designers create the RTL description.
The process of converting the gate-level netlist into a physical layout.
The final set of comprehensive verification steps performed before tape-out to ensure design correctness and manufacturability.
The stage where power delivery networks are optimized across the chip.
The formal agreement between the design team and the customer on project specifications.

questions.question: What is the main role of a Branch Predictor in a modern pipelined Central Processing Unit (CPU)?
options: To manage the flow of data between the CPU and main memory.
To determine the outcome of conditional branch instructions before they are actually executed, reducing pipeline stalls.
To perform arithmetic and logical operations on data.
To translate virtual addresses into physical addresses.
To ensure that multiple processors maintain a consistent view of shared memory.

questions.question: Which of the following describes the phenomenon where a transistor's threshold voltage changes due to variations in the voltage difference between its source and bulk (substrate)?
options: Hot Carrier Injection (HCI)
Negative Bias Temperature Instability (NBTI)
Drain-Induced Barrier Lowering (DIBL)
The Body Effect
Gate Oxide Breakdown (GOB)

questions.question: In computer architecture, what is 'Effective Access Time (EAT)' primarily used to quantify?
options: The maximum speed at which data can be transferred between memory and the CPU.
The total number of memory accesses performed by a program.
The average time taken to access a memory location, considering the presence and performance of the memory hierarchy (caches, main memory).
The latency of a single access to the fastest level of cache memory.
The time required for the CPU to switch between different processes.
